sen.j: 沖田林太郎（おきたりんたろう 文政10年（1827年）- 明治16年（1883年））は幕末の新徴組隊士。
sen.e: Rintaro OKITA (1827 to 1883) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) at the end of the Edo period.
Rintaro OKITA (1827 to 1883) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) at the end of the Edo period.
Rintaro OKITA (1827 to 1883) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) at the end of the Edo period.
His wife was Mitsu OKITA.
His wife was Mitsu OKITA.
His wife was Mitsu OKITA.

sen.j: 新選組一番組長沖田総司の義兄。
sen.e: He was a brother-in-law of Soji OKITA, the leader of the First Group of Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: 一番組長は leader of the First Group としました。
sen.e: He was a brother-in-law of Soji OKITA, the leader of the First Group of Shinsengumi.
He was a brother-in-law of Soji OKITA, the leader of the First Group of Shinsengumi.
His imina (personal name) was Fusamasa.
His imina (personal name) was Fusamasa.
His imina (personal name) was Fusamasa.

sen.j: 八王子千人同心の井上家に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to the Inoue family of Hachioji Sennin Doshin (junior officials in Hachioji).
He was born to the Inoue family of Hachioji Sennin Doshin (junior officials in Hachioji).
He was born to the Inoue family of Hachioji Sennin Doshin (junior officials in Hachioji).

sen.j: 近藤周助の門人となって天然理心流剣術を学び免許を得た。
sen.e: He became an apprentice of Shusuke KONDO, learned the swordsmanship of Tennen Rishinryu School and obtained the license.
He became an apprentice of Shusuke KONDO, learned the swordsmanship of Tennen Rishinryu School and obtained the license.
He became an apprentice of Shusuke KONDO, learned the swordsmanship of Tennen Rishinryu School and obtained the license.

sen.j: 弘化3年（1846年）、沖田みつと結婚して沖田家の家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: He married Mitsu OKITA in 1846 to become the head of Okita family.
He married Mitsu OKITA in 1846 to become the head of Okita family.
He married Mitsu OKITA in 1846 to become the head of Okita family.

sen.j: 嘉永6年（1853年）、長男沖田芳次郎が生まれる。
sen.e: His first son Yoshijiro OKITA was born in 1853.
His first son Yoshijiro OKITA was born in 1853.
His first son Yoshijiro OKITA was born in 1853.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）、浪士組に近藤勇、沖田総司とともに参加。
sen.e: He joined Roshigumi together with Isami KONDO and Soji OKITA in 1863.
He joined Roshigumi together with Isami KONDO and Soji OKITA in 1863.
He joined Roshigumi together with Isami KONDO and Soji OKITA in 1863.

sen.j: 三番組（小頭新見錦）に属して京都へ上る。
sen.e: As a member of the Third Group (headed by Nishiki NIIMI), he went to Kyoto.
As a member of the Third Group (headed by Nishiki NIIMI), he went to Kyoto.
As a member of the Third Group (headed by Nishiki NIIMI), he went to Kyoto.

sen.j: 浪士組の帰東に際して近藤勇ら天然理心流一門は京に残留するが、林太郎はこれに加わらず江戸へ帰る。
sen.e: Although the members of Roshigumi who were from the Tennen Rishinryu school, including Isami KONDO, did not follow the return of Roshigumi to Edo and stayed in Kyoto, Rintaro returned to Edo without following his fellows.

Although the members of Roshigumi who were from the Tennen Rishinryu school, including Isami KONDO, did not follow the return of Roshigumi to Edo and stayed in Kyoto, Rintaro returned to Edo without following his fellows.

Although the members of Roshigumi who were from the Tennen Rishinryu school, including Isami KONDO, did not follow the return of Roshigumi to Edo and stayed in Kyoto, Rintaro returned to Edo without following his fellows.

sen.j: 後に浪士組は新徴組に改編されて庄内藩御預かりとなり、江戸市中警護に当たった。
sen.e: Roshigumi was later reorganized to Shinchogumi (Tokugawa Shogunate guard organization), put under the control of Shonai Domain, and was in charge of guarding of Edo.
Roshigumi was later reorganized to Shinchogumi (Tokugawa Shogunate guard organization), put under the control of Shonai Domain, and was in charge of guarding Edo.
Roshigumi was later reorganized to Shinchogumi (Tokugawa Shogunate guard organization), put under the control of Shonai Domain, and was in charge of guarding Edo.

sen.j: 林太郎は組頭を務めている。
sen.e: Rintaro served as the head of a group.
Rintaro served as the head of a group.
Rintaro served as the head of a group.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）、江戸幕府が消滅すると庄内藩主酒井忠篤_(庄内藩主)は帰国することになり、林太郎もこれに同行した。
sen.e: When the Tokugawa Shogunate disappeared in 1868, Tadazumi SAKAI, lord of Shonai Domain, returned to his home domain, and Rintaro followed him.
When the Tokugawa Shogunate terminated in 1868, Tadazumi SAKAI, lord of Shonai Domain, returned to his home domain, and Rintaro followed him.

He returned to Tokyo in 1872.

He died in 1883.
